# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " -" => "_")
end
```
The `replace` function replaces all occurrences of the second argument (i.e., " -" => "_") in the first argument ("My Column" => "my_column"). The `lowercase` function converts a string to lower case and `strip` removes leading and trailing whitespaces from a string.
